Package org.jboss.windup.rules.apps.mavenize

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    Dependency
    Dependency reference can be anything that can appear in pom.xml's dependencies: A library, project cross-module dependency, another app (EAR, WAR), etc.
    DependencyDeducer
    Adds the appropriate API dependencies to Maven POMs based on what's found in the project.
    GlobalBomModel
    Serves only to identify the unique singleton object in the DB.
    PomXmlModel
    Represents the structure of a Maven POM file within the graph.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    ArchiveCoordinateService
    Contains methods for searching and creating ArchiveCoordinateModels.
    MavenCoord
    A POJO for Maven coordinate.
    MavenizationService
    Performs the actions needed to mavenize an application.
    MavenizeGroupIdOption
    Gives the user the option to skip class not found analysis.
    MavenizeOption
    Gives the user the option to skip class not found analysis.
    MavenizeRuleProvider
    Creates a stub of Maven project structure, including pom.xml's and the proper directory structure and dependencies, based on the project structure determined by prior Windup rules (nested deployments) and the libraries included in them.
    MavenStructureRenderer
    Recursively renders the previously created Maven project structure into pom.xml's in a directory tree.
    ModuleAnalysisHelper
    Contains methods for assistance in analyzing modules
    PackagesToContainingMavenArtifactsIndex
    This is a service class that provides information about which artifacts contain the given package.
    Pom
    A simplified POM model - just G:A:V:C:P and the dependencies.
    RegisterApiPackagesInTypeInterestFactoryRuleProvider
    To actually get the queriable data about certain classes into the graph, they need to be registered in .
    SimpleDependency
    Represents a simple dependency for the purposes of determining provided dependencies.
  • Enum Summary 
    Enum Description
    Dependency.Role
    Whether the target artifact is internal project's module, third-party library, or an API definitions for the services provided by the application server.
